super fun and challenging escape room style game im stuck on a bit of a math related puzzle right now just counting off on a base 4 grid and it is honestly frying my brain a bit but in the kind of way that once i get it oooooh i am going to be so proud of myself i refuse to look up any of the answers so its slow going but the exploration is pretty rad too graphics arent terrible for something this old either enjoy

i enjoyed myst and then riven and this game is very similar to those  keep up the good work
dense graphics and music complex puzzles demanding concentration and memory initial game can be frustrating but perseverance provides great rewards

right up there with myst and riven for me loved the game world and story love that the puzzles mostly arent puzzles but are part of the world that have a reason to be there and to be the way they are they are perplexing to the player because they are not of the world that said from a game design perspective some players may be frustrated with how much traversal is required in some sections but i enjoyed taking in the sights and sounds

obduction is a quintessential cyan puzzle game theres some world hopping similar to visiting different ages in myst fmv sequences and a science fiction narrative that strings the whole game together  towards the end the game mechanics to jump between worlds get a little repetitive but its in service of solving the puzzles if you liked the myst games i wholeheartedly recommend obduction

great trip down memory lane and if you understand what youre getting into a myst like game youll probably enjoy it  not sure how younger generations might take this game compared to most modern games its slow not super polished and has a very basic interface if youre into point and click puzzles you should like it these guys defined the genre
very interesting graphics and good puzzles similar to myst games the game play is awesome
in the tradition of the myst series

a true followup to cyans greatest and a wholehearted recommend filled to the brim with mindbending puzzles and secrets that i didnt even discover until the second playthrough the music slaps what more could you wish for

great game i found the game very challenging and it took me more than one attempt to solve it which made it even more rewarding when i was able to move forward overall the game with its lore and graphics really grabbed me fair warning there are a couple of red herrings and overall things can be frustrating because there are almost no hints most of the time for what you have to do next i want to play more games like this
intriguing story line that has many different dimensions and many many challenges along the way totally absorbing and universally perplexing

obduction is an amazing game that is designed like a modern myst it feels familiar yet completely alien  the only thing that got annoying after a while are all the loading screens but its nothing gamebreaking

if you love puzzle games and you loved myst this game holds up 8 years on it is meandering but if you stick with it it has an intriguing story my recommendation is to play it through in a shorter time frame because it is easy to forget what you were going to do next if you leave it for a month or more

obduction is badly implemented the game has ok graphics clunky movement every other section of the map there will be real time loading of something causing stuttering the puzzles are nice but the gameplay modest dont raise your expectations this is made by cyan but not on par of myst or riven get it on sale

love it after playing and enjoying 4 of the myst games this did not disappoint the scenery is beautiful as it tends to be in cyan games and i really enjoyed the environmental storytelling that made me put all sorts of little pieces together the puzzles can be pretty difficult and it took me a while to get through the whole thing but im very glad i did

its another game from the guys that made myst so if youre into myst youll like this one  it seems to have been made with vr in mind so it doesnt feel like a pointandclick adventure shoehorned into vr  beautiful environments wide variety of vr things to do  i havent finished it yet but its been great so far

great spiritual follow up to the myst games  plays like them but modern a little more user friendly a little easier but only very little and a different kind of story but story still told in much the same way

the fun for me  and what i liked the most  was figuring out what was going on not how to beat it  there is a logic but its illusive  the maze is a highlight  not too tough not too easy  overall you enter a world which you really want to leave  but to leave you have to take that world with you  so again the most fun is figuring out what the rules are and how to get those rules to work for you instead of driving you nuts  all in all great fun game
very much like the myst games lots of puzzles to solve at your own pace
great game looks beautiful nice game mechanics
ok follow up to the myst series
excellent
all myst serie fans should play this game the 3d graphics are amazing and immersive and the game mechanics is original

what a wonderful adventure especially in vr even for a 2016 game it looks super crisp in 2024 and the environments are very detailed and with beautiful textures especially the rocks in hunwrath you might get stuck but most of the time a little bit of exploration and experimentation will help get unstuck highly recommend if you like myst or riven

yes but i only recommend one playthrough the puzzle mechanics rely on you jumping back and forth between worlds to solve them which is tedious at best once you complete one of those puzzles you dont ever want to do it again also this is the first vr game that made me nauseous and the vr controls behave strangely

this game is very graphically wonderful as well as the game play is not mind breaking but makes you work for it i did get a bit tired trying to remember which transport seeder or device i had to use to get to some areas i would highly recommend it and if you get stuck there are some amazing walk throughs to get you back on track i actually learned math lol which would make my mathemetician father very glad i learned base 4  if you like puzzles this is a game for you
very difficult to play but that is why i like it

an absolutely fantastic feather in the cap of the legacy of myst  i feel there are few games that really understood what made the myst series special and it doesnt surprise me at all that the it took the original creators to come back and show people how it is done  is youre looking for a creative world to explore with interesting puzzles and storytelling obduction is for you

i played obduction in vr from start to finish  its well written and the puzzles are designed to make you think and nothing is ever too challenging  in vr texture and geometry details pop in a bit too close to the player and it can be distracting at times

i loved everything about this game you really have to figure out everything by yourself which makes it super rewarding when you finally manage to solve a puzzle except for the russian machine  the russian machine

this is a really good puzzle box of a game  nothing is really just handed to you and requires you to explore deduce reason learn and straight up puzzle you way through it  my biggest complaint is that sometimes you have a to walk really far to hit a switch sort of say to then allow you access  just be sure to use your camera and keep track of your notes that have been found  this game is not for the impatient

this game is great in vr mode and is the spiritual and creative successor to the myst franchise of the 1990s the puzzles are challenging and take some time but not as difficult as the original puzzles in myst riven etc you will probably end up needing to look a few things up on an online guide somewhere because a couple puzzles have solutions that are a bit of a reach still a fun game though
ive always been a fan of this genre of game  this series in particular is quite entertaining
as magical as the original myst but make sure you have a walkthrough for the maze puzzle or youll go insane
